choices.E: Journey Builder allows users to update a contact record in a journey or import data into a data extension.
choices.B: Automation Studio and Journey Builder allow users to repeat an interaction indefinitely.
choices.D: Journey Builder allows users to inject Contacts from a data extension which is updated by Automation Studio.
choices.C: Automation Studio and Journey Builder allow users to define a wait activity based on duration.
choices.A: Journey Builder and Automation Studio allow users to define the parameters for a send within the tool.

discussion.content: Journey Builder doesn't allow to import data into a data extension. Wait activities exist in Automation Studio and Journey Builder.

Selected Answer: ACD
Wait duration can be defined in both tools. A,C,D

Selected Answer: ACD
ACD are correct

Selected Answer: ACD
E is totally wrong

questions.question_text: Which three statements are correct regarding the automation tools in Marketing Cloud? (Choose three.)

Collect addresses through Smartcapture, segment the data, send emails referencing data from a data extension.
What skillset is needed?

discussion.content:
"Smartcapture" = HTML/CSS
"segment the data" = SQL or Data filter
"send emails referencing data from a data extension." = AMPscript or Dynamic Content

Selected Answer: A
First 2 actions can be done without sql and third cannot be done with SQL, it's a tricky question but answer for me is A - Ampscript.

Selected Answer: A
AMPScript is correct
DTC Force goes above and beyond to match your growth goals, strategies, and vision.
I think the question may have a typo. It may be asking which skillsets (choose 2).

comments.content: Just a thought: you could segment the data with filters instead of SQL, but you can't reference data in the email without AMPscript.
This is not referencing on what is used in emails but instead talking about segmenting data and referencing DE's

discussion.content: SQL is totally incorrect answer! It's never used in emails. AMPscript is the best choice to use in Email Studio for email personalization. The same works for Smart Capture as it is a Email Studio tool.

questions.question_text:
A customer has an eCommerce site and imports data into three data extensions daily: Orders, Order_Details, and Products. The data extensions contain the following information:
✑ Orders: OrderID, CustomerID, OrderNumber, OrderDate, OrderTotal, GrandTotal.
✑ Order_Details: ProductID, OrderID, Qty, UnitPrice, ExtendedPrice, Discount.
✑ Products: ProductID, SKU, Name, Description, Cost, Price.
Which two actions should be taken in Data Designer? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: A&C should be correct as there should be a 1:1 between order_details and products (primary key product id) as products has more information about each product id listed in the order details

Only a is correct, if order details and products have a one to one relationship, that means one order detail record can only point to one product (which is true) and one product can only ever point back to one order detail record, which is wrong

choices.B: Create a one-to-one relationship between Orders and Order_Details.
choices.D: Create a one-to-one relationship between the contact record and Order_Details.
choices.C: Create a one-to-one relationship between Order_Details and Products.
choices.A: Create a one-to-many relationship between Orders and Order_Details.

questions.question_text:
ABC Company needs to provide an IT staff member with access to Marketing Cloud. The staff member needs to perform the following tasks:
✑ Maintain ABC Company's master suppression list.
✑ Configure data relationships.
✑ Create new subscriber attributes.
Which role should be assigned to the IT staff member?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Data Manager Role - Access to everything in Email Studio except email content

REF - https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_overview_roles.htm&type=5
Data Manager Role doesn;t exist in Marketing Cloud.

choices.A: A user-initiated message to send an email to customers who made a purchase daily.
choices.C: A scheduled automation to send emails to customers who made a purchase daily.
choices.B: Triggered Import - user initiated send (not scheduled).

questions.question_text:
ABC Company wants to import files at certain standard times, but occasionally a file will be dropped on a Friday if the 30th of the month falls on a weekend.
What is the flow?
questions.answer_description: If a question is related to automation and it mentions that a file will be available in the FTP always at a specific time, your answer will be an option with a scheduled automation. Scheduled automations are used when you know the time a file is pushed into FTP and it always runs at a scheduled time. If a question is related to automation and there is an uncertainty when the file will be pushed to FTP (ex; a day before last working day / if a date falls on a weekend, it will be available on last Friday etc.), your answer will be an option with a Triggered Automation. Triggered Automations are fired as soon as a file hits a specific location within FTP. Transfer activity is involved when file in encrypted.
